author: aetos382
body:
The [README](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/f4ac0935c530be5b33c3fc043b574b95d41a1ca5/README.md#get-powershell), updated for the release of PowerShell 7.1, links the Windows version of LTS download to 7.1.0.
PowerShell 7.1 depends on .NET 5, and .NET 5 is not an LTS release.
Looking at the [documentation](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/PowerShell-Docs/blob/bba4088cf63b89957edacc43551f0abb5bab4e4e/reference/docs-conceptual/PowerShell-Support-Lifecycle.md#powershell-releases-end-of-life), the EOL in 7.1 is earlier than 7.0.

comments.author: fMichaleczek
comments.body:
The blog is clear : 7.1 isn't LTS. https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/announcing-powershell-7-1/ @aetos382 can you rename your issue to something like "LTS version number in the README is wrong"
PowerShell
Announcing PowerShell 7.1 | PowerShell
We’re proud to announce the release of PowerShell 7.1, the latest major update to PowerShell 7. This release includes a number of improvements and fixes that build on top of the PowerShell 7.0 release in March and the recent GA release of .NET 5.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Looks like a "search and replace" mistake.  Will get this fixed.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:
:tada:This issue was addressed in #14070, which has now been successfully released as `v7.2.0-preview.1`.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.2.0-preview.1)

title: LTS version number in the README for Windows is wrong
